title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
11:21 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <@cjdelisle> lol  
12:04 <+sburjan> :)  
12:04 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: platform/tools should become xwiki-tool-\*? Like xwiki-tool-jetty-resources  
12:04 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you're talking about the gitmodule repo?  
12:05 <@sdumitriu> ?  
12:05 <vmassol> it mus thave platform in the name  
12:05 <@sdumitriu> I'm talking about repo names for each module, and directory names inside xwiki-platform/tools  
12:05 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-tool-\*  
12:05 <vmassol> since they're platform tools  
12:05 <vmassol> vs common tools  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: http://incubator.apache.org/gora/  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> hmm there's no guest user object, just an XWikiGuest document.  
12:07 <Avipar> has quit  
12:10 <@cjdelisle> interesting (gora) I also noticed OpenJPA was working on the same goals but nobody seems to have the momentum of DN  
12:34 <mflorea> has quit  
12:44 <pulasthi1> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <pulasthi> has quit  
13:03 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle:: hi  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
13:03 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle:i i did some changes  
13:03 <pulasthi1> to the proposal  
13:03 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
13:04 <pulasthi1> but cdnt find a alternative for dn  
13:04 <pulasthi1> so i didnt mention it  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> I would mention that you looked around and there wasn't anything compelling.  
13:05 <pulasthi1> ahh ok :)  
13:05 <pulasthi1> btw thanks for that srript yeasterday  
13:05 <pulasthi1> \*script  
13:06 <@cjdelisle> I looked around too and i found openjpa which is is working on supporting nosql databases but is not there yet.  
13:06 <pulasthi1> ahh :)  
13:07 <pulasthi1> u guys are busy these days arent u  
13:07 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:07 <@cjdelisle> Also Sergiu pointed out http://incubator.apache.org/gora/ which is really really new IE has like 50 commits and 6 issues in the bug tracker.  
13:08 <pulasthi1> ahh ok ill mention them btw did get accepted  
13:08 <pulasthi1> :D  
13:08 <pulasthi1> \*u  
13:08 <pulasthi1> as a mentor  
13:08 <@cjdelisle> I don't know  
13:09 <pulasthi1> i looked around to check for amazon or rackspace  
13:09 <pulasthi1> i think amazon is better  
13:09 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:10 <@cjdelisle> Amazon is ok, their storage thing is scary  
13:10 <@cjdelisle> elastic storage  
13:10 <@cjdelisle> constantly failing  
13:10 <@sdumitriu> It's not supposed to be failing  
13:11 <@cjdelisle> From what I've read it's like a network block device and it breaks a lot.  
13:11 <pulasthi1>   http://code.mixpanel.com/amazon-vs-rackspace/  
13:11 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:12 <@cjdelisle> When you're swamped with network traffic, guess what... your disk stops responding.  
13:12 <pulasthi1> well that choice want be that much of importance for the project because u can change it any time  
13:12 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:13 <@cjdelisle> The reddit people are using the elastic storage for their databases and they have some horror tales about them.  
13:13 <pulasthi1> ahh :/  
13:14 <@cjdelisle> The solution is just use Amazon with an ephimeral disk instead of the elastic storage.  
13:15 <pulasthi1>  cjdelisle: :) . im off for a while  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> I wonder if Google AppEngine is the right target  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> It's proprietary  
13:15 <@cjdelisle> +1  
13:15 <@sdumitriu> I'd rather go towards OpenStack or other open cloud infrastructures  
13:16 <@cjdelisle> GAE is really cool but it's proprietary and it only supports version 1 of DN.  
13:16 <@cjdelisle> DN is version 2.0 final and 3.0M3  
13:17 <@cjdelisle> I would suggest that google isn't really serious about java support, GAE is more of a python thing.  
13:17 <pulasthi1> it started as python right  
13:17 <@cjdelisle> I asked about java in #appengine and people were like "java?"  
13:17 <pulasthi1> they later introduced java  
13:18 <@cjdelisle> Good sign that it's back burner'd.  
13:18 <malygin> has quit  
13:19 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle: im off for a while bye  
13:19 <pulasthi1> :)  
13:19 <@cjdelisle> see ya  
13:20 <pulasthi1> has left #xwiki

14:59 <+sburjan> vmassol: I documented Dashboards  
14:59 <+sburjan> but I was thinking they need also some reference on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/FeaturesExtract too  
14:59 <+sburjan> because they are bundled on the platform (the Macro)  
14:59 <+sburjan> so IMo it should also be listed on the platform subwiki  
15:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Hi!  
16:09 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Is there a way to show the online status of xwiki users ?  
16:10 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Another issue is on my other wiki with the public url: https://www.computer42.org/xwiki/bin/export/DevNotes/WebHome?format=pdf&pagebreaks=1&comments=1&attachments=1&includelinks=6&includechilds=6  
16:12 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] ^H^H^H... forget the other issue  
16:13 <@cjdelisle> a way to tell if which users are online. You mean like who has been logged in and loaded a page within the last like 5 minutes?  
16:13 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] yes sir :-)  
16:14 <@cjdelisle> s/like/some configurable value near/  
16:15 <@cjdelisle> You might be able to leverage the stats plugin if that is installed.  
16:17 <@cjdelisle> Otherwise, maybe have a document which contains names of each user and when they last loaded a page. Add an #includeTopic('statsDocument') in view.vm and in that document put code which modifies the document each time a user loads a page.  
16:17 <@cjdelisle> It would not perform well  
16:18 <@cjdelisle> Then you would have to read the values from the document and get the ones which were less than 5 minutes old.  
16:18 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: It's better to just use the existing stats  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> Recording visits manually is not a good idea  
16:19 <@cjdelisle> \*shrug\* then I guess the answer is use the stats plugin if you have it, if you don't then install it, if you can't then you're sunk.  
16:22 <supreet> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: stats plugin is part of xwiki-core, but it needs to be enabled  
16:31 <@cjdelisle> Hmm, I didn't know that.  
16:33 <Avipar1> has quit  
16:33 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] The stats plugin is IMHO installed and enabled.  
16:33 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] sdumitru: You may access it: http://www.pfarreiengemeinschaft-westum-loehndorf.de/xwiki2/bin/view/Stats/pgwlStats  
16:36 <vmassol> sdumitriu: working with git and IDEs is a pain  
16:36 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: How come?  
16:36 <vmassol> in git you keep switching branches  
16:36 <vmassol> so when you move to your IDE's window  
16:36 <vmassol> it has to reload everything  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> Doesn't the IDE have support for switching branches?  
16:38 <vmassol> the ide uses the file system  
16:41 <vmassol> sorry just made a mistake  
16:41 <vmassol> wanted to push only 1 commit  
16:41 <vmassol> I did:  git push origin 188dd490c2b26bc33ae0699a6c555f481bd9fdd8:master  
16:41 <vmassol> and it committed all my changes....  
16:41 <vmassol> :(  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> Was that the last commit?  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> If so, then it pushes commits up to the specified one  
16:46 <vmassol> yeah that's what I understood...  
16:46 <vmassol> too late....  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> Don't worry, commits are good  
16:47 <vmassol> yeah except it's a non working commit  
16:47 <vmassol> (not even tested)  
16:55 <@sdumitriu> git revert  
16:55 <vmassol> but this isn't an unpush....  
16:55 <vmassol> when I said "commit" I meant "push"ed  
16:59 <@cjdelisle> With git, revert makes a reverse patch IIRC.  
16:59 <@cjdelisle> whereas git reset does what svn revert does.  
17:04 <@cjdelisle> "If you find a bug. Please fork the code, create a test case, and submit a pull request with the issue. This will allow me to quickly determine the cause and resolve the issue."  
17:04 <@cjdelisle> That's a neat way of doing it  
17:15 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
17:15 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] How can I access the online status of users via the stats-plugin ?  
17:16 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: yep sounds very nice  
17:16 <+tmortagne> but not always easy to hope for something like that :)  
17:16 <@cjdelisle> heh  
17:20 <pulasthi> famancinelli , cjdelisle : hi about the app engine project whoudnt the name of the project rather be smthing like "XWiki on distributed database"  
17:21 <pulasthi> becuse when the name only says about app engine it sounds quit odd to talk about cassandra  
17:21 <pulasthi> :)  
17:22 <@cjdelisle> It sounds good from my perspective but I'm really in no position of authority on that.  
17:23 <pulasthi> famancinelli: WDYT  
17:23 <pulasthi> :)  
17:23 <fmancinelli> pulasthi: good point  
17:24 <pulasthi> so is it ok if i change the name in the proposal  
17:24 <pulasthi> :)  
17:24 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <mpaun\_> has quit  
17:26 <pulasthi> fmancinelli : great :)  
17:26 <pulasthi> thanks  
17:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I've done a git mv of a directory but I've made a mistake  
17:26 <vmassol> can I do another git mv on top of the previous one or should I, somehow, revert?  
17:27 <@cjdelisle> if you have not committed then you can just git reset --hard HEAD (that will set it back to the head and lose any uncommitted work)  
17:28 <vmassol> I don't want to loose anything! :)  
17:28 <vmassol> are you 100% sure it's only going to revery that specific change and not everything?  
17:28 <vmassol> s/revery/revert/  
17:29 <@cjdelisle> reset --hard will destroy all uncommitted work (!)  
17:29 <vmassol> ok so that's not my question  
17:29 <vmassol> I definitely don't want to revert the whole branch....  
17:30 <@cjdelisle> In my experience, I have been able to move files and move them back and git forgets it ever happened.  
17:30 <@cjdelisle> are you using "git status" to see what you have uncommitted at any given time?  
17:31 <@cjdelisle> I find that very helpful.  
17:32 <fmancinelli> I think that's safe to move it back... finally git doesn't really support "moves", it only has heuristics to understand if things have been moved around  
17:32 <fmancinelli> warning: I am just guessing though :)  
17:34 <anurup> has quit  
17:34 <@cjdelisle> Another really nice feature is squash. If you're making a lot of changes you can make a whole bunch of micro commits then at the end squash them together.  
17:34 <@cjdelisle> ofc easy to abuse  
17:34 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <anurup> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <@cjdelisle> fmancinelli: did you ever get this?: There is no available StoreManager of type "cassandra". Make sure that you  
17:37 <@cjdelisle> I can't figure out what I am doing wrong.  
17:39 <fmancinelli> cjdelisle: are you talking about my code snippet?  
17:39 <@cjdelisle> Trying to get the .tar.gz you sent up and running  
17:40 <fmancinelli> cjdelisle: you need this: https://github.com/tnine/Datanucleus-Cassandra-Plugin  
17:40 <@cjdelisle> Yup, I'm pulling it in through maven  
17:41 <@cjdelisle> maybe I'm not actually pulling it in. Maybe that's the problem.  
17:43 <fmancinelli> and you have to use the xml in META-INF that use the cassandra backend (rename one of the existing one to jdo-config.xml if I am not wrong)  
17:44 <@cjdelisle> It's picking those up. I moved them into /resources/ and loaded them as .jar resources. It's probably just a dependency I removed.

19:39 <@sdumitriu> git co xwiki-2.7  
19:39 <@sdumitriu> git merge xwiki-application-administration-1.44.1  
19:40 <@sdumitriu> This pulls xwiki-platform-administration in 2.7

21:19 <Chami1> refering to google android client for xwiki. it should implement edit pages, objects in XWiki via the app. will a html editor window will be enough for this  
21:37 <shweta> has quit  
22:01 <@sdumitriu> Chami1: Might be, but I'm not sure it's a good solution. XWiki has its own WYSIWYG editor, which should be integrated instead  
22:01 <kasun> has quit  
22:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:06 <Danker> has joined #xwiki  
22:06 <Danker> Hi  
22:06 <@sdumitriu> Hi  
22:10 <Danker> I am interested in two project proposals for GSOC for xwiki, but template in google-melange is "fit" only for one. Does anyone have guidelines how to apply for two project ideas :)? Ofc I would do only one of them, but if one is unavailable (is given to another student) I would to do the other one :) (if I am chosen at all :D) .  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> Danker: You should make two different proposals, one for each project  
22:11 <Danker> So it is ok to apply two times in google melange?  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
22:11 <Danker> Thanks :)  
22:15 <Chami1> sdumitriu: thanx for the idea  
22:16 <Chami1> sdumitiu: but i think there will be issues in the browser level  
22:17 <@sdumitriu> What kind of issues?  
22:17 <Chami1> sdumitiu: since this is an androd app it should not take much memory and might face rendering problems  
22:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
22:18 <@sdumitriu> The editor should work well in WebKit  
22:18 <Chami1> sdumitiu: anyway I will check the compatibility using an android device  
22:19 <@sdumitriu> You can test it by editing a wiki page  
22:19 <Chami1> sdumitiu: android browser built using webkit. but h/w isn't enough for rendering. It will not an issue in high end phones. but have to think about other phones  
22:21 <Chami1> sdumitiu: this might not be a good question. but can you give me a link for wiki editing page which doesn't have much content? (for low data usage)  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/TestPage3  
22:28 <Chami1> sdumitriu: thank you very much
